table.name: admin_user
table.remarks: To track the associated roles and status active/inactive of admin users of the application

table.name: admin_user_history
table.remarks: History is updated when there is change in roles or status of the admin user.

table.name: admin_user_onboarding
table.remarks: To track pending admin users of the application that are waiting to be onboarded.

column.name: assigned_roles
column.remarks: Roles assigned to the user.Comma separated list of roles that can be assigned to the user

column.name: is_onboarded
column.remarks: Flag to indicate if the user has been onboarded or not

table.name: calculated_data_history
table.remarks: This table stores the calculated data associated with previous versions of published reports. When a report is updated, the report's calculated data is transferred from `pay_transparency_calculated_data` table to the `calculated_data_history` table. The purpose and meaning of the calculated data is described in the comments of the `pay_transparency_calculated_data` table. The calculated data history is used as an internal archival record, and is not accessible to the end user.

column.name: calculated_data_history_id
column.remarks: The primary ID to identify this specific record in the table

column.name: calculated_data_id
column.remarks: The original ID before moving the record to the history table.

column.name: report_history_id
column.remarks: Identifies which report that this calculated data history is associated with. This references the primary key of `report_history` table.

column.name: report_id
column.remarks: The ID of the original report associated with the record.

column.name: calculation_code_id
column.remarks: Identifies which statistic this record is storing. References the primary key of `calculation_code` table.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The statistic that indicates any disparity in gender pay, which will be shown as a graph in the resulting report. If there is insufficient information to calculate the statistic, value will be null.

column.name: is_suppressed
column.remarks: Will be set to true if there is not enough information to calculate a statistic. Suppressed statistics are not included in the outputted report.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time when this record was inserted into `pay_transparency_calculated_data`.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time when this record was last modified while in `pay_transparency_calculated_data`. Records in the history table are not modified.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who created the record in `pay_transparency_calculated_data`.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who modified the record in `pay_transparency_calculated_data`. Records in the history table are not modified.

table.name: calculated_data_view
table.remarks:
This view is a union of the `pay_transparency_calculated_data` table and `calculated_data_history` table. The column `calculation_code.calculation_code` have been included in this view.
This view allows the webapp to fetch the calculated data for any report regardless of if that report is in the history table or not. It is used in combination with the `reports_view` view to fetch a single report with that report's history and also get the calculated data from this view.
There are no new columns in this view, but some columns from the two `calculated_data` tables are not included in this view.
table.viewSql: SELECT data.calculated_data_id, data.report_id, data.calculation_code_id, data.value, data.is_suppressed, code.calculation_code FROM (( SELECT data_1.calculated_data_id, data_1.report_id, data_1.calculation_code_id, data_1.value, data_1.is_suppressed FROM pay_transparency.pay_transparency_calculated_data data_1 UNION SELECT data_1.calculated_data_history_id AS calculated_data_id, data_1.report_history_id AS report_id, data_1.calculation_code_id, data_1.value, data_1.is_suppressed FROM pay_transparency.calculated_data_history data_1) data LEFT JOIN pay_transparency.calculation_code code ON ((code.calculation_code_id = data.calculation_code_id)));

column.name: calculated_data_id
column.remarks: The primary ID to identify this specific record in the table.

column.name: report_id
column.remarks: Identifies which report that this calculated data is associated with. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_report` table.

column.name: calculation_code_id
column.remarks: Identifies which statistic this record is storing. References the primary key of `calculation_code` table.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The statistic that indicates any disparity in gender pay, which will be shown as a graph in the resulting report. If there is insufficient information to calculate the statistic, value will be null.

column.name: is_suppressed
column.remarks: Will be set to true if there is not enough information to calculate a statistic. Suppressed statistics are not included in the outputted report.

column.name: calculation_code
column.remarks: A unique, human readable string used to identify the algorithm for data calculation. The webapp uses this code to lookup the `calculation_code_id` to save the value in the `pay_transparency_calculated_data` table.

table.name: calculation_code
table.remarks: This is a lookup table of all 57 statistics, known as 'calculations', that relate to calculating any disparity in gender pay such as the mean hourly pay difference. The webapp has the `calculation_code` in two places, when calculating the statistics to store in the `pay_transparency_calculated_data` table, and when adding the statistics in the report. These operations require looking up either the `calculation_code_id` or the `calculation_code` from this table.

column.name: calculation_code_id
column.remarks: The ID of the calculation code which is referenced in the two `calculated_data` tables. The webapp uses this ID to lookup the `calculation_code` when retrieving the calculated data for use on the report.

column.name: calculation_code
column.remarks: A unique, human readable string used to identify the algorithm for data calculation. The webapp uses this code to lookup the `calculation_code_id` to save the value in the `pay_transparency_calculated_data` table.

column.name: description
column.remarks: An explanation of the formula used to perform this calculation.

table.name: company_history
table.remarks: This table stores the old company records. If a company has published a report, but has since changed their business address, this table stores the old company address so that generating the old report can display the company information that was originally provided for that report.

column.name: company_history_id
column.remarks: Primary unique ID for this company history record.

column.name: company_id
column.remarks: Primary unique ID for this company. Referenced on the `pay_transparency_company` table.

column.name: bceid_business_guid
column.remarks: The BCeID unique ID for this company. Used to associate a user with a company.

column.name: company_name
column.remarks: The name of the employer provided by BCeID account.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date this company record was entered into the `pay_transparency_company` table.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date this company record was last updated.

column.name: address_line1
column.remarks: Street address provided by BCeID account.

column.name: address_line2
column.remarks: Optional second address line provided by BCeID account.

column.name: city
column.remarks: City provided by BCeID account.

column.name: province
column.remarks: Province provided by BCeID account.

column.name: country
column.remarks: Country provided by BCeID account.

column.name: postal_code
column.remarks: Postal Code provided by BCeID account.

table.name: employee_count_range
table.remarks: This is a lookup table that stores the employee count ranges, for example '50-100'. The user selects from a list on the form how many employees their employer has which is recorded in the `pay_transparency_report` table.

column.name: employee_count_range_id
column.remarks: The primary unique id. Used in the two report tables.

column.name: employee_count_range
column.remarks: The name of this record which is shown to the user.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: When the value was inserted/created.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: When the value was modified.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The minimum date for which the range can be visible to the users.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The last day that this value will be shown to the user.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The database user who initially created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The database user who modified the record.

table.name: naics_code
table.remarks:
This is a lookup table that stores only the 1st level (of 5 levels) codes of the current North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) data. The user is required to select a NAICS code for each report.
[North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Canada 2022 Version 1.0](https://www23.statcan.gc.ca/imdb/pUtil.pl?Function=getNote&Id=1369825&NT=45)

column.name: naics_code
column.remarks: The NAICS code which is either a number (eg 11) or a range of numbers (eg 31-33).

column.name: naics_label
column.remarks: The name of the sector (eg 'Construction') of the NAICS code.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The minimum date for which the code can be visible to the users.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: A code will be visible to the users if the value is not set or the current date is not later than the date value of this column.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: When the value was inserted/created

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: When the value was modified

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The database user who initially created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The database user who modified the record.

column.name: naics_year
column.remarks: The year on which the code was created by Statistics Canada

table.name: pay_transparency_calculated_data
table.remarks:
This table holds the statistics for a company's pay transparency report that shows any pay disparity between genders. Every report has 57 records (ie. statistics) in this table, collectively known as 'calculated data'. The records in this table are statistics calculated from the file submitted by users and are used in the report. Records are identified and described by a `calculation_code_id` from the `calculation_code` table. If insufficient data prevents a statistic from being calculated, a record is still created with a null value and `is_suppressed` set as true.
Calculated data linked to draft reports that are older than 48 hours are deleted automatically on a schedule.

column.name: calculated_data_id
column.remarks: The primary ID to identify this specific record in the table.

column.name: report_id
column.remarks: Identifies which report that this calculated data is associated with. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_report` table.

column.name: calculation_code_id
column.remarks: Identifies which statistic this record is storing. References the primary key of `calculation_code` table.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The statistic that indicates any disparity in gender pay, which will be shown as a graph in the resulting report. If there is insufficient information to calculate the statistic, value will be null.

column.name: is_suppressed
column.remarks: Will be set to true if there is not enough information to calculate a statistic. Suppressed statistics are not included in the outputted report.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time when this record was inserted. This is used for deleting calculated data records associated with draft reports that are older than 48 hours.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time when this record was modified. Records cannot be modified from the webapp, instead the user is required to submit a new report.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who modified the record. Records cannot be modified from the webapp, instead the user is required to submit a new report.

table.name: pay_transparency_company
table.remarks:
These are the details provided by a BCeID Business account for a logged in user. The name and address will be included on a report.
If a user logs in without a BCeID Business account, or if the BCeID Business account is missing information, the login will not proceed and the record will not be created.

column.name: company_id
column.remarks: Primary unique ID for this company. Referenced on the `pay_transparency_report` table.

column.name: bceid_business_guid
column.remarks: The BCeID unique ID for this company. Used to associate a user with a company.

column.name: company_name
column.remarks: The name of the employer provided by BCeID account.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date this company record was entered into the database.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date this company record was last updated. The record is updated if there are changes. The old record is copied to the company_history table.

column.name: address_line1
column.remarks: Street address provided by BCeID account.

column.name: address_line2
column.remarks: Optional second address line provided by BCeID account.

column.name: city
column.remarks: City provided by BCeID account.

column.name: province
column.remarks: Province provided by BCeID account.

column.name: country
column.remarks: Country provided by BCeID account.

column.name: postal_code
column.remarks: Postal Code provided by BCeID account.

table.name: pay_transparency_report
table.remarks:
This table stores the latest versions of draft and published reports. Each report is submitted by a BCeID user, identified by `user_id`, and is associated with an employer with a BCeID Business account, identified by `company_id`.
Reports are created after the user submits the form in the webapp. Initially `report_status` will be 'draft', but the user can choose to publish the report which changes it's `report_status` to 'published'. The form allows the user to select `employee_count_range_id`, `naics_code`, `reporting_year`, `report_start_date`, `report_end_date`, `user_comment`, and `data_constraints`.
Each employer will have one published report per `reporting_year`. When a draft report is published, the existing published report (if there is one) will be copied into the `report_history` table. Once a report is published, the `report_id` will stay the same even if it is updated. `revision` keeps track of the number of times a report has been updated after being published.
Reports that have a `create_date` older than 30 days are locked on a schedule run daily. Reports with is_unlocked set to false, cannot be modified by the user. An admin can set `is_unlocked` to true, which will allow the user to publish a new report for the same `reporting_year`. After 3 days, it will automatically be locked again.
Draft reports that are older than 48 hours are deleted automatically on a schedule.

column.name: report_id
column.remarks: Primary unique ID for this report. Even when a published report is updated, this ID stays the same.

column.name: company_id
column.remarks: The employer (a BCeID Business) the report is made for. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_company` table.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The user who created/modified this report. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_user` table.

column.name: user_comment
column.remarks: User optionally fills this text area on the form, called 'Employer statement', which is shown at the top of the report. This is for additional information about the employer.

column.name: employee_count_range_id
column.remarks: User selects range indicating the number of employees an employer has on the form, which is shown on the report. This references the primary key of `employee_count_range` table.

column.name: naics_code
column.remarks: User selects the NAICS code for their business on the form, which is shown on the report. This references the primary key of `naics_code` table.

column.name: report_start_date
column.remarks: Start date of the report, which is shown on the report, and always a year before the end date. The range could be a calendar year, fiscal year, school year, or any range the employer prefers. A user can choose either the start date or end date for the report on the form. The other date is automatically calculated.

column.name: report_end_date
column.remarks: End date of the report, which is shown on the report, and always a year before the end date. A user can choose either the start date or end date for the report on the form. The other date is automatically calculated.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time when the first revision was inserted. This is used for locking published reports older than 30 days.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time when this revision was modified. This is used for deleting draft reports older than 24 hours.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who modified the record.

column.name: report_status
column.remarks: Reports are first created with the status of 'Draft' and the user can publish their report which changes the status to 'Published'.

column.name: revision
column.remarks: Every published report has a revision. Each time a published report is replaced the revision goes up.

column.name: data_constraints
column.remarks: User optionally fills this text area on the form, which is shown at the bottom of the report. This is for any relevant information, such as limitations, constraints, or dependencies, that may help explain the employers payroll data.

column.name: is_unlocked
column.remarks:
This signifies when a published report can be modified or not. Draft reports can always be created regardless of this field.
When `is_unlocked` is true on a published report, then a draft report in the same `reporting_year` can be published overwriting the existing published report.
Published reports are unlocked for 30 days from the `create_date` before they are automatically locked by a schedule. Administrators can unlock a report, which will be locked again after 3 days from `report_unlock_date`.

column.name: reporting_year
column.remarks: User selects the calendar year this report is for. Each employer is limited to one report annually. This is distinct from the report's start and end dates as employers may generate reports for any period, like a fiscal or school year, yet the specific year the report pertains to may not be discernible from those dates.

column.name: report_unlock_date
column.remarks: This date is set by an administrator and is used by a scheduled task to change `is_unlocked` to false after 3 days.

table.name: pay_transparency_user
table.remarks: Users log in with their BCeID account which must be associated with a BCeID business account. The unique ID's of both accounts are stored to identify this user and business in future logins.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: Primary unique id used in the two report tables.

column.name: bceid_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique id provided by the BCeID service to identify this user.

column.name: bceid_business_guid
column.remarks: The unique id provided the the BCeID service to identify which employer this user is associated with.

column.name: display_name
column.remarks: This is the full name of the user.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date this user record was entered into the database.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date this user record was last updated. The record is automatically updated every time the user logs in even if there are no changes.

table.name: report_history
table.remarks: This table stores the report information of old published reports that have been replaced with a new version. Old draft reports are not stored. When a published report is updated, the report's information is copied from `pay_transparency_report` table to the `report_history` table. The purpose and meaning of the report information is described in the description of the `pay_transparency_report` table. Previous reports are not modified and are used as an internal archival record, and are not accessible to the end user.

column.name: report_history_id
column.remarks: Primary unique id for this history report.

column.name: report_id
column.remarks: The report that this id used to be in the `pay_transparency_report` table. Can be thought of as a grouping; the most recent published report, and all history reports for the same `reporting_year` will have the same `report_id`. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_report` table.

column.name: company_id
column.remarks: The employer (a BCeID Business) the report is made for. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_company` table.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The user who created/modified this report. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_user` table.

column.name: employee_count_range_id
column.remarks: User selects range indicating the number of employees an employer has on the form, which is shown on the report. This references the primary key of `employee_count_range` table.

column.name: user_comment
column.remarks: User optionally fills this text area on the form, called 'Employer statement', which is shown at the top of the report. This is for additional information about the employer.

column.name: report_start_date
column.remarks: User selects the start date of the report, which is shown on the report. Start date is always a year before the end date. The range could be a calendar year, fiscal year, school year, or any range the employer prefers.

column.name: report_end_date
column.remarks: User selects the end date of the report, which is shown on the report. End date is always a year after the start date.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time when the first revision was inserted into the `pay_transparency_report` table.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time when this revision was modified.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who created the record in the `pay_transparency_report` table.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who modified the record.

column.name: report_status
column.remarks: History reports will always be 'Published'. Draft reports are never saved to history.

column.name: naics_code
column.remarks: User selects the NAICS code for their business on the form, which is shown on the report. This references the primary key of `naics_code` table.

column.name: data_constraints
column.remarks: User optionally fills this text area on the form, which is shown at the bottom of the report. This is for any relevant information, such as limitations, constraints, or dependencies, that may help explain the employers payroll data.

column.name: revision
column.remarks: Every published report has a revision. Each time a published report is replaced the revision goes up.

column.name: is_unlocked
column.remarks: History reports are not modified, so this field has no meaning in the `report_history` table. This field will always be 'true' since reports must be unlocked before being replaced and moving to the history table.

column.name: reporting_year
column.remarks: User selected the year this report is for. Each employer is limited to one report annually. This is distinct from the report's start and end dates as employers may generate reports for any period, like a fiscal or school year, yet the specific year the report pertains to may not be discernible from those dates.

column.name: report_unlock_date
column.remarks: History reports are not modified, so this field has no meaning in the `report_history` table.

table.name: reports_view
table.remarks:
This view is a union of the `pay_transparency_report` table and `report_history` table. The columns `naics_code.naics_label` and `employee_count_range.employee_count_range`, as well as the full address and company name from `pay_transparency_company` have been included in this view.
This view allows the webapp to fetch the most recent report as well as the historical versions of the report in one query.
Only one new column is created in this view, `report_change_id`, which is used to associate this view with the `calculated_data_view` view. The `is_unlocked` column from the two report tables is not included in this view.
table.viewSql: SELECT report.report_id, report.report_id AS report_change_id, report.company_id, report.user_id, report.user_comment, report.employee_count_range_id, report.naics_code, report.report_start_date, report.report_end_date, report.create_date, report.update_date, report.create_user, report.update_user, report.report_status, report.revision, report.data_constraints, report.reporting_year, report.report_unlock_date, naics_code.naics_label AS naics_code_label, company.company_name, company.bceid_business_guid AS company_bceid_business_guid, company.address_line1 AS company_address_line1, company.address_line2 AS company_address_line2, company.city AS company_city, company.province AS company_province, company.country AS company_country, company.postal_code AS company_postal_code, employee_count_range.employee_count_range FROM (((pay_transparency.pay_transparency_report report LEFT JOIN pay_transparency.naics_code naics_code ON (((naics_code.naics_code)::text = (report.naics_code)::text))) LEFT JOIN pay_transparency.pay_transparency_company company ON ((company.company_id = report.company_id))) LEFT JOIN pay_transparency.employee_count_range employee_count_range ON ((employee_count_range.employee_count_range_id = report.employee_count_range_id))) WHERE ((report.report_status)::text = 'Published'::text) UNION SELECT report.report_id, report.report_history_id AS report_change_id, report.company_id, report.user_id, report.user_comment, report.employee_count_range_id, report.naics_code, report.report_start_date, report.report_end_date, report.create_date, report.update_date, report.create_user, report.update_user, report.report_status, report.revision, report.data_constraints, report.reporting_year, report.report_unlock_date, naics_code.naics_label AS naics_code_label, company.company_name, company.bceid_business_guid AS company_bceid_business_guid, company.address_line1 AS company_address_line1, company.address_line2 AS company_address_line2, company.city AS company_city, company.province AS company_province, company.country AS company_country, company.postal_code AS company_postal_code, employee_count_range.employee_count_range FROM (((pay_transparency.report_history report LEFT JOIN pay_transparency.naics_code naics_code ON (((naics_code.naics_code)::text = (report.naics_code)::text))) LEFT JOIN pay_transparency.pay_transparency_company company ON ((company.company_id = report.company_id))) LEFT JOIN pay_transparency.employee_count_range employee_count_range ON ((employee_count_range.employee_count_range_id = report.employee_count_range_id))) WHERE ((report.report_status)::text = 'Published'::text);

column.name: report_id
column.remarks: Primary unique ID for this report. Even when a published report is updated, this ID stays the same.

column.name: report_change_id
column.remarks: This id is created from merging the `report_id` from the `pay_transparency_report` table and `report_history_id` from the `report_history` table. It is used to associate this view with the `calculated_data_view` view.

column.name: company_id
column.remarks: The employer (a BCeID Business) the report is made for. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_company` table.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The user who created/modified this report. This references the primary key of `pay_transparency_user` table.

column.name: user_comment
column.remarks: User optionally fills this text area on the form, called 'Employer statement', which is shown at the top of the report. This is for additional information about the employer.

column.name: employee_count_range_id
column.remarks: User selects range indicating the number of employees an employer has on the form, which is shown on the report. This references the primary key of `employee_count_range` table.

column.name: naics_code
column.remarks: User selects the NAICS code for their business on the form, which is shown on the report. This references the primary key of `naics_code` table.

column.name: report_start_date
column.remarks: User selects the start date of the report, which is shown on the report. Start date is always a year before the end date. The range could be a calendar year, fiscal year, school year, or any range the employer prefers.

column.name: report_end_date
column.remarks: User selects the end date of the report, which is shown on the report. End date is always a year after the start date.

column.name: create_date
column.remarks: The date and time when the first revision was inserted. This is used for locking published reports older than 30 days.

column.name: update_date
column.remarks: The date and time when this revision was modified. This is used for deleting draft reports older than 24 hours.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The username of the database user who modified the record.

column.name: report_status
column.remarks: Reports are first created with the status of 'Draft' and the user can publish their report which changes the status to 'Published'.

column.name: revision
column.remarks: Every published report has a revision. Each time a published report is replaced the revision goes up.

column.name: data_constraints
column.remarks: User optionally fills this text area on the form, which is shown at the bottom of the report. This is for any relevant information, such as limitations, constraints, or dependencies, that may help explain the employers payroll data.

column.name: reporting_year
column.remarks: User selects the year this report is for. Each employer is limited to one report annually. This is distinct from the report's start and end dates as employers may generate reports for any period, like a fiscal or school year, yet the specific year the report pertains to may not be discernible from those dates.

column.name: report_unlock_date
column.remarks: This date is set by an administrator and is used by a scheduled task to change `is_unlocked` to false after 3 days.

column.name: naics_code_label
column.remarks: The name of the sector (eg 'Construction') of the NAICS code.

column.name: company_name
column.remarks: The name of the employer provided by BCeID account.

column.name: company_bceid_business_guid
column.remarks: The BCeID unique ID for this company. Used to associate a user with a company.

column.name: company_address_line1
column.remarks: Street address provided by BCeID account.

column.name: company_address_line2
column.remarks: Optional second address line provided by BCeID account.

column.name: company_city
column.remarks: City provided by BCeID account.

column.name: company_province
column.remarks: Province provided by BCeID account.

column.name: company_country
column.remarks: Country provided by BCeID account.

column.name: company_postal_code
column.remarks: Postal Code provided by BCeID account.

column.name: employee_count_range
column.remarks: The name of the employee count record, for example '50-100'.
